name: Directory in C
small_description: A terminal app to access data
long_description: In my first year of BUT, I had to create a TUI (Terminal User Interface) for a directory that allowed accessing user telephone data. It was a two-person project, and for a first real dive into C, it actually went pretty well! At first, figuring out memory management and handling user input felt a bit overwhelming, but as we kept going, things started to click. I had a lot of fun experimenting, breaking things, and then fixing them. Looking back, it was a great learning experience, and Iâ€™m really glad I got to explore C in such a hands-on way!

name: Maki-Malin

long_description: In my second year of BUT, I teamed up with two colleagues to build a shopping list application using Symfony PHP. It was a really fun project because it made understanding the basics of back-end and front-end feel super intuitive. Setting up routes and integrating them with Twig was honestly pretty cool! We had a lot of freedom in how we approached the project, which let us push it way further than expectedâ€”something that really impressed our teacher. Overall, it was a great experience, and we had a blast working on it! Also, the name of the application was Maki Malin, which explains the Sushi logo.

name: Management ERP for the IUT
small_description: Main project of my 3rd year in BUT Informatique
long_description: Development of a management ERP for the IUT using Spring Boot and Angular, enabling the management of timetables, grades, absences, and other administrative modules. This project taught me how to build a full-stack application from A to Z within a team of 17 people. I mainly worked on the user management module.
